question: Which Indian airport emerged as the Asia Pacific’s best airport in ‘over 40 million passengers per annum category’ in ASQ 2019 rankings?
explanation:
The Indira Gandhi International Airport, New Delhi has emerged as the Asia-Pacific’s best airport in the ‘Over 40 million passengers per annum category’ in the Airport Service Quality Programme (ASQ) 2019 rankings.
The rankings are released by the Airports Council International. The Indira Gandhi International  Airport, which is undergoing a major expansion, handled around 69 million passengers last year.
